According to research, elderly individuals (ages 60 and above) are more likely to reoffend after being released from prison compared to other age groups. This is because older individuals tend to have more life experience and may have developed more mature coping mechanisms, but they also tend to have more physical and cognitive decline, which can impact their ability to adapt to new situations and make good decisions.
